lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s government moved swiftly to re-establish control after the failure of the attempted coup.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Safak Timur from Istanbul, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, Gardiner Harris from Luxembourg, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

headline.print_headline: Government, Moving Swiftly, Rounds Up Thousands of Military Personnel
headline.main: Turkey Rounds Up Thousands of Military Personnel

snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s government moved swiftly to re-establish control after the failure of the attempted coup....
abstract: Government of Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan moves swiftly to reclaim city of Istanbul after deadly attempted coup that Erdogan attributes to followers of Muslim cleric Fethullah Gulen.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
